definition[0]: to borrow money by having a second mortgage on your house, or increasing the one you have
example[0]: We may have to remortgage the house.
definition[1]: to borrow money by having a second or bigger MORTGAGE (=loan) on your property, especially a house
example[1]: He advised me to remortgage with a lender with a lower interest rate.
example[2]: Millions of homeowners have remortgaged their homes to take advantage of lower interest deals.
definition[2]: a second or bigger MORTGAGE on your property, especially a house
example[3]: A remortgage is one of the cheapest ways of borrowing money.
